intro: Salpichroa longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. Salpichroa longiflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal dunes.
